item.title: Truman's Rd Covered In Litter, 28th July
item.description:
This is a continuous issue but for well over a week now there have been piles of rubbish and litter strewn all across Truman's Rd. It's disgusting having to walk amongst filth and see it from our homes. Bins are emptied and anything that falls out is left.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Salcombe Road, Hackney, London

item.description:

item.title: Dog in no dog zone/threating behaviour, 28th July
item.description:
I was in the park early evening yesterday, and was sitting in the middle part, no dog zone at just after 7pm a man came through with a jack russel. I tried to explain to him, he couldn't take his dog through there - to which I received a torrent of abuse and threats that his wife would smash me in - if I didn't shut up! Police were called, and attended, but he had left by then. My question is, why hasn't cameras/security been properly addressed? Refusing CCTV due to privacy, doesn't wash with the public, as there are in other parks. How many more times, do I or others have to be threatened, by vile local trash. It's bad enough, volunteers have to patrol, due to the risk to wildlife of catapulting. Your contractors - Ward, do little if anything, other than lock up! The enforcement officers, attend once in a blue moon. So of course, the local criminals, think can do as they like. Something needs to be done, before someone is hurt. About time council, put their hand in their pocket, and protected their rate payers, rather than their coffers. I'll also be contacting my local councillors! Thank you.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 2-4, High Street, Poverest, Orpington, London
Report on FixMyStreet
